isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON 2000 SERIES™ (LCT) TRANSMISSION ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - ELECTRICAL OPERATION - ANTILOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) INTERFACE

svcproc.title: ANTILOCK BRAKE SYSTEM (ABS) INTERFACE
svcproc.para: A ground from the gray TCM connector (3031) terminal 28 is present on circuits 128, 128E, 128C and terminal 5 of the ABS SIG GROUND RELAY.

If the ABS brake system senses an impending wheel lockup condition and modulates the brake system (to prevent wheel lockup), a ground from the ABS controller will energize the ABS SIG GROUND RELAY. This will pass the ground from circuit 128 through the closed contacts of the relay to circuit 113 and terminal 13 of gray TCM connector (3031).
The transmission lockup clutch (and engine or exhaust retarder, if equipped) will be disengaged, and the transmission will "hydraulically" link to the drive wheels rather than mechanically.
